name: OTHER APPLICANT INTENDING TO APPLY FOR FO
body:
Case number: ((reference number))
Applicant 1: ((applicant 1 name)) 
Applicant 2: ((applicant 2 name)) 
Your reference: ((solicitor reference)) 

Dear ((solicitor name))

The other applicant in this joint application is intending to apply for a Final Order as a sole applicant. This might be because you have not confirmed the joint application for a final order yet, on behalf of your client. 

#If you do nothing
The other applicant will be able to apply to apply for final order from ((date plus 14 days)) as a sole applicant. If the court makes the final order then the ((isDivorce ??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership)) will be legally ended. 

#If your client needs more time to settle their finances
You can make an application to the court to delay the issuing of the final order, on behalf of your client. You can do this by filling out a D11 application form and sending it to the court. You need to do this by ((date plus 14 days)).

You can download the D11 form here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/form-d11-application-notice

You can upload it to your case. 

#If your client wants to legally end the ((isDivorce ??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership))
You can sign into your account and confirm the joint application for a final order, on behalf of your client. 

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
subject: Other applicant is intending to apply for a final order
